title: My Body and Five Senses

vocab.definition: Ways our body learns about the world around us
Using your eyes to see things
Using your ears to hear sounds
The body part you use to smell
The body part you use to taste
The body parts you use to hear
The body parts you use to see
Using skin to feel how things are
Things we eat like fruits, vegetables, and bread

teachingNotes: Use sensory exploration activities. Practice identifying body parts. Discuss healthy habits like brushing teeth and washing hands.

sample.question: What do you use to see?
How do you keep your teeth healthy?
What body part helps you walk?
How do you know if something is loud?
What should you do before eating?

truefalse.question: Your ears help you see colors.
expectedAny: ears are for hearing, eyes see colors

truefalse.question: Washing hands helps keep you healthy.
You can smell with your feet.
Sleep is important for your body.
expectedAny: sleep helps body rest and grow

truefalse.question: You touch things with your nose.
expectedAny: you touch with hands and skin

multiplechoice.question: Which sense do you use to smell flowers?
What helps your body grow strong?
Which body part helps you hear?
How often should you brush your teeth?
What do you use to pick up toys?
Which sense tells you if something is soft?
What should you do when you cough?

fillintheblank.question: You use your _____ to hear music.
Your _____ help you walk and run.
_____ keeps your body healthy and strong.

shortanswer.question: Name three things you can do to stay healthy.
How do you take care of your body?
Which body parts help you learn about the world?
Why is it important to wash your hands?
What foods help your body grow?
How do your senses work together?

wordProblems.question: Emma uses 2 senses to enjoy her snack: she sees it and tastes it. How many senses is she using?
There are 5 senses. If you cover your eyes and ears, how many senses can you still use?
Jake brushes his teeth 2 times a day for 7 days. How many times does he brush his teeth in a week?
In the class, 8 children wash their hands before snack and 2 forget. How many children washed their hands?
Sarah counts 10 fingers on her hands. How many fingers are on each hand?
There are 6 children. If each child has 2 eyes, how many eyes are there in total?
Tom eats 3 healthy foods at lunch and 2 healthy foods at dinner. How many healthy foods did he eat?
